i think is some obj reference bug that Swig induced , so i propose by del sess or gc.collect(), if it not reliable as report before, further debug TBD

@kengz clear_session is not delete，original code is

def clear_session():
    """Destroys the current TF graph and creates a new one.
    Useful to avoid clutter from old models / layers.
    """
    global _SESSION
    global _GRAPH_LEARNING_PHASES
    tf.reset_default_graph()
    reset_uids()
    _SESSION = None
    phase = tf.placeholder(dtype='bool', name='keras_learning_phase')
    _GRAPH_LEARNING_PHASES[tf.get_default_graph()] = phase

body:
i think is some obj reference bug that Swig induced , so i propose by `del sess` or `gc.collect()`, if it not reliable as report before, further debug TBD 


@kengz clear_session is not delete，original code is
```
def clear_session():
    """Destroys the current TF graph and creates a new one.
    Useful to avoid clutter from old models / layers.
    """
    global _SESSION
    global _GRAPH_LEARNING_PHASES
    tf.reset_default_graph()
    reset_uids()
    _SESSION = None
    phase = tf.placeholder(dtype='bool', name='keras_learning_phase')
    _GRAPH_LEARNING_PHASES[tf.get_default_graph()] = phase
```
